review.title: State-space Abstraction for Anytime Evaluation of Probabilistic Networks
review.abstract: An important factor that determines the computational complexity of the evaluation of a probable network is the cardinality of the state spaces of the nodes. By varying the granularity of the state spaces, one can exchange the accuracy of the result for the computational efficiency. We present a procedure for approximate evaluation of probable networks that can be applied at any time, based on this idea. Applied to some simple networks, the procedure shows a gentle improvement of the approximation quality with increasing computational time. This suggests that the abstraction of state spaces is a more useful control parameter for the development of probable arguments in real time.
